data.Title: Google Launches June 2024 Spam Update
data.Description: Google has released a new spam update targeting websites that engage in spammy practices. The update is expected to impact search rankings and could take up to a week to fully roll out.

data.Title: Google's AI Overviews Shaking Up Ecommerce SEO
data.Description: Google’s AI Overviews (AIOs) has disrupted eCommerce, forcing online retailers to rethink their search strategies. PYMNTS breaks it down.

data.Title: Google Search Experiencing Indexing Issues
data.Description: Google Search is experiencing an indexing issue affecting major websites, with reports of new content not being indexed or served. Google has acknowledged the issue and is working on a fix.

data.Title: Google Search Image Thumbnails Disappear for Some Sites
data.Description: If a website's image thumbnails have disappeared from Google Search snippets, it is likely due to quality issues with the site rather than technical problems, according to Google's John Mueller.

data.Title: Google Tests New Features in Search Results
data.Description: Google is experimenting with several new features in its search results, including a "latest deals" section, a floating search bar in Discover, and the display of both "Top-quality store" and "shop rating" labels in snippets.

data.Title: Google Maps Exploit Allows Manipulation of Business Listings
data.Description: A Google Maps exploit has been discovered that allows individuals to move competitors' map pins, potentially harming their local rankings and even leading to business suspensions.

data.Title: Google Local Service Ads Coming to Google Maps
data.Description: Google is rolling out Local Service Ads within Google Maps, starting with iOS devices. Businesses cannot opt out of these ads without completely disabling Local Service Ads.

data.Title: Publishers Seek to Capitalize on Amazon Prime Day 2024
data.Description: Publishers are implementing three key strategies to maximize affiliate commerce revenue during Amazon Prime Day 2024, leveraging lessons learned from the previous year.

data.Title: The Trade Desk Blocks Yahoo Video Inventory
data.Description: The Trade Desk has cut open marketplace access to Yahoo’s video inventory in an ongoing dispute over how inventory is represented.
